item.title: Manhunt underway after gunman kills ten, injures several in Montenegro restaurant: 'All police teams are - The Times of India
item.description:
Manhunt underway after gunman kills 10, injures several in Montenegro restaurant: 'Insane'

Publication Date and Source: 2023-01-01, The Times of India

Image with Caption:

Introduction: A gunman opened fire at a restaurant in Montenegro, killing 10 people and injuring 35. The incident occurred on New Year's Eve, and the gunman remains at large. Authorities have launched a manhunt to apprehend the suspect.

  • Key Points:
    • The gunman opened fire at a restaurant in Montenegro on New Year's Eve.
    • 10 people were killed and 35 were injured in the incident.
    • The gunman is still at large, and authorities are conducting a manhunt.
    • The motive behind the attack is yet to be determined.
  • Notable Quotes or Statistics:
    The suspect is still at large, and no arrests have been made yet. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. - Montenegro Police
  • Conclusion:

    The incident in Montenegro has left the country in shock, with authorities working tirelessly to apprehend the gunman. As more information comes to light, the public is urged to remain vigilant and report any suspicious activity to the authorities.

item.title: ‘Pure act of evil’: Trump blames illegal immigration for New Orleans attack as Biden blasted for ‘tone deaf’ response - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump Calls New Orleans Attack a 'Pure Act of Evil', Blames Illegal Immigration

Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The deadly truck attack in New Orleans, which resulted in at least ten fatalities and multiple injuries, has been condemned by President-elect Donald Trump as a “pure act of evil” linked to illegal immigration. This incident has sparked significant political backlash against President Joe Biden for his perceived insensitive response.

  • Trump labeled the attack as tied to illegal immigration, emphasizing it as a major issue ahead of the 2024 election.
  • He noted that the suspect crossed the border just two days before the attack.
  • Biden faced criticism for his social media post that seemed oblivious to the tragedy.
  • The FBI is involved in investigating the attack alongside local authorities.
“When I said that the criminals coming in are far worse than the criminals we have in the country... it turned out to be true,” - Donald Trump

The incident has ignited a fervent debate concerning immigration policies and political accountability, highlighting a growing divide in public sentiment as 2024 approaches.

  • Witnesses reported hearing gunfire after the crash.

This tragic event has raised concerns about security and safety in urban areas.

item.title: 'DEI s**tshow', 'terror attack or not': X users rage over New Year horror in New Orleans that killed 10 - The Times of India
item.description:
New Orleans New Year Horror: 10 Dead, Public Outrage over 'DEI S**tshow'

Published on January 2, 2023 - Source: Times of India

New Orleans' New Year celebrations turned into a tragedy as at least 10 people were shot dead and 10 others injured in a crowded street near the French Quarter. The incident has sparked outrage, with many questioning the lack of police presence and control measures. Some users on social media have dubbed it a 'DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) s**tshow' and a 'terror attack', criticizing the city's policies.

  1. At least 10 people were killed and 10 more injured in a shooting near New Orleans' French Quarter on New Year's Eve.
  2. The incident has sparked public outrage, with many questioning the city's safety measures and policies.
  3. Some users on social media have criticized the city's 'DEI' policies, suggesting they may have contributed to the lack of control.
'This is a tragedy. We need answers and action now.' - New Orleans resident

With the city still grieving, authorities are investigating the incident and promising stricter control measures for future events.

item.title: Influencer chugs two bottles of whisky in 20 minutes to win ₹75,000 challenge, dies - Hindustan Times
item.description:
A 21-Year-Old Influencer Dies After Whisky Challenge

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

A 21-year-old influencer in Thailand died after drinking two bottles of whisky in 20 minutes as part of a challenge. Thanakarn Kanthee, known as "Bank Leicester" online, accepted the challenge for money but died of alcohol poisoning.

  1. The influencer had previously taken on similar drinking challenges.
  2. The man who hired Kanthee for the challenge has been arrested and faces up to 10 years in jail.
  3. Video footage shows the crowd cheering as Kanthee collapsed.
  4. A social media post by Kanthee reveals he undertook such challenges to provide for his family.
"I am willing to be bullied and insulted to just get scraps of money from the rich people in order to provide for my family." - Thanakarn Kanthee

Source: Hindustan Times

item.title: Ukraine halts transit of Russian gas to Europe after a prewar deal expired - The Hindu
item.description:
Ukraine halts transit of Russian gas to Europe after a prewar deal expired

Published on: January 01, 2025, by The Hindu

Ukraine has halted the flow of Russian gas supplies to European customers after a prewar transit deal expired, citing national security concerns. This decision follows nearly three years of conflict as Russia continues its invasion.

  • The energy minister, German Galushchenko, announced the stoppage “in the interest of national security.”
  • Russia’s Gazprom claims it lacks the ability to supply gas due to Ukraine's refusal to extend the transit deal.
  • The cease in gas transit could lead to significant financial losses for Russia as Europe aims to phase out Russian gas.
  • Prior to the war, Russia supplied approximately 40% of the EU's pipeline natural gas.
  • Ukraine's move aligns with Europe’s strategy to eliminate reliance on Russian gas by 2027.
“This is a historic event. Russia is losing markets and will incur financial losses.” - German Galushchenko

As a result of the ongoing conflict, Europe has begun diversifying its gas suppliers, significantly reducing dependence on Russian energy.

item.title: Pakistan sees surge in deadly attacks in 2024 - DW (English)
item.description:
Pakistan's Deadliest Year: A Surge in Militant Attacks in 2024

Published on: 2024-12-31
Source: DW

Pakistan suffered an alarming surge in militant attacks in 2024, an annual report showed on Tuesday. The Islamabad-based research group, Center for Research and Security Studies, disclosed that 2024 was the deadliest year for Pakistani security services in nine years, with a 40% increase in militant attacks compared to the previous year. A total of 905 incidents resulted in 1,177 deaths and 1,292 injuries, including 444 Islamist terrorist attacks that killed 685 soldiers and police officers and 927 civilians. The surge in violence was attributed to Islamist militants operating from across the border with Afghanistan.

  1. The Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan claimed the highest number of attacks, seeking to implement Islamic Sharia law in the country.
  2. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) insurgent group was responsible for the second-highest number of attacks, seeking independence from the federal government.
  3. The surge in attacks resulted in an average of nearly seven lives lost daily.
  4. The cumulative losses of civilians and security personnel accounted for over 63% of the total recorded this year.
  5. The frequency and intensity of BLA attacks have significantly evolved in terms of operational strategy and capabilities.

On Tuesday, militants mounted assaults against a security post, a government office, and a police van in the country's restive northwest, killing a policeman and two others, including a child.

"On average, nearly seven lives were lost daily," the report said, also taking into account the number of dead insurgents.

The Pakistani Taliban is suspected to be behind these recent attacks. The surge in violence has raised concerns about the country's security and stability.

item.title: 10 killed, several injured as truck rams into crowd in New Orleans; ‘terrorist attack,’ says mayor - The Indian Express
item.description:
10 killed, 30 injured as truck rams into crowd in New Orleans; ‘terrorist attack,’ says mayor

Date: Wednesday, Source: BBC, CBS News

At least 10 people were killed and 30 more injured after a truck drove into a crowd on Bourbon Street in New Orleans. The driver exited the vehicle and began firing a weapon before police returned fire.

  • The truck crashed into a crowd at high speed during New Year’s celebrations.
  • New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell described the incident as a “terrorist attack.”
  • Witnesses reported the driver firing a weapon after the crash.
  • Injured individuals were taken to five local hospitals.
  • The incident occurred shortly before the AllState Bowl college football game.
  • Historical context: Similar events have occurred in New Orleans, including previous shootings and vehicle attacks.
“There has been a mass casualty incident on Canal and Bourbon Street. Get yourself away from the area.” - Nola Ready

This tragic incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding safety during large public events in urban areas.

item.title: New Orleans terror attack: 10 dead, over 30 injured after vehicle rams into crowd, FBI finds explosive device - India TV News
item.description:
New Orleans Terror Attack: 10 Dead and Over 30 Injured After Vehicle Rams Into Crowd

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: India TV News

At least ten people were killed and 30 injured after a car rammed into people celebrating the new year in New Orleans, a southern US city. Police officials reported that a vehicle ploughed into a crowd on Bourbon Street in the city's French Quarter.

  • The attack was deemed intentional, with the suspect firing at security officials.
  • New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell labeled the incident as a “terrorist attack”.
  • Bourbon Street was crowded with New Year’s celebrants at the time.
  • The FBI discovered an explosive device at the scene.
“This is a terrorist attack,” said Mayor LaToya Cantrell.

This tragic incident marred the New Year’s celebrations in New Orleans and raises urgent concerns about public safety.
